credentials.translation[0].definitions[0: someone’s education, achievements, experience etc that prove they have the ability to do something
He spent the first part of the interview trying to establish his credentials as a financial expert.
Her academic credentials include an MA and a PhD.
She had excellent credentials for the job.
There are doubts over his credentials as a future prime minister.
credentials.translation[0].definitions[1: a letter or other document which proves your good character or your right to have a particular position
The commissioner presented his credentials to the State Department.
credentials.translation[1].definitions[0: the training, education, or experience that give you the ability to do a particular job or task well, especially in the opinion of other people
You’ll be given a three-month probationary period to fully establish your credentials as an accountant.
credentials.translation[1].definitions[1: a letter or other document that proves that someone is who they say they are or has the ability to do a particular job or task
Swiss police checked the drivers’ credentials before allowing them to pick up the delegates.
